subject: Olympic Games (2008)
lead_paragraph: Jacques Rogge, the president of the International Olympic Committee, said he was optimistic that China could improve its famously bad air before the Beijing Olympics in August. Rogge said that Beijing was making big strides in cutting pollution. Rogge had warned that some events at the Olympics could be postponed if the air quality is poor, but he hoped much of the pollution will be cleaned up when the Games start. “We will see that they have made major progress,” Rogge said at the Fourth I.O.C. World Conference on Women and Sport in Southern Shuneh, Jordan.
